intro: Cypella lutea, commonly known as the yellow cypella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in a cluster, which bloom in late summer. Cypella lutea typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and prefers full sun exposure. It is often found in coastal and arid regions, where it thrives in well-drained environments.
